docs.title: Readability
docs.text: Documentation readability analyzer - GitHub Action and CLI tool for measuring content quality metrics.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Readability analyzes your documentation and provides actionable metrics to help you write clearer, more accessible content. Whether you're maintaining technical documentation, writing blog posts, or creating user guides, Readability helps ensure your content is easy to understand.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Flesch Reading Ease - How easy is your content to read?
  • Grade Level Scores - Flesch-Kincaid, Gunning Fog, Coleman-Liau, SMOG, ARI
  • Word & Sentence Metrics - Count, averages, complexity indicators
  • Multiple Output Formats - Table, Markdown, JSON, Summary, Report
  • Threshold Enforcement - Fail CI when quality drops

docs.title: GitHub Action
docs.text:
- uses: adaptive-enforcement-lab/readability@v1
  with:
    path: docs/
    format: markdown
    check: true
    max-grade: 12

docs.title: CLI
docs.text:
# Analyze a directory
readability docs/

# Check with thresholds
readability --check --max-grade 12 docs/

docs.title: CLI Reference
docs.text: The Readability CLI provides full access to all analysis features from the command line.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: go install github.com/adaptive-enforcement-lab/readability/cmd/readability@latest

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text:
# Analyze a single file
readability docs/index.md

# Analyze a directory (recursive)
readability docs/

# Output as JSON
readability --format json docs/

docs.title: Quick Reference
docs.text: Flag Short Description --format -f Output format: table, json, markdown, summary, report --verbose -v Show all metrics --check Check against thresholds (exit 1 on failure) --config -c Path to config file --max-grade Maximum Flesch-Kincaid grade level --max-ari Maximum ARI score --max-lines Maximum lines per file

docs.title: readability [path]
docs.text: Analyze markdown files for readability metrics.

docs.title: Arguments
docs.text: Argument Description path File or directory to analyze (required)

docs.title: Output Options
docs.text:
--format, -f : Output format. Options: table, json, markdown, summary, report. Default: table.

--verbose, -v : Show all available metrics in output.

docs.title: Threshold Options
docs.text:
--check : Enable check mode. Exit with code 1 if any file fails thresholds.

--max-grade : Maximum Flesch-Kincaid grade level. Overrides config file.

--max-ari : Maximum ARI score. Overrides config file.

--max-lines : Maximum lines per file. Set to 0 to disable. Overrides config file.

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text: --config, -c : Path to configuration file. Default: auto-detect .content-analyzer.yml.

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
# Basic analysis
readability docs/

# JSON output
readability --format json docs/

# Check with custom thresholds
readability --check --max-grade 10 --max-ari 12 docs/

# Verbose output
readability -v docs/

# Use specific config
readability -c .readability.yml docs/

docs.title: Exit Codes
docs.text: Code Description 0 Success (all files pass or check mode disabled) 1 Failure (one or more files failed thresholds in check mode)

docs.title: Configuration File
docs.text: Readability automatically looks for .readability.yml in the target directory or git root.

docs.title: File Location
docs.text:
The tool searches for the config file in this order:

  1. The directory being analyzed
  2. Parent directories up to the git root
  3. If not found, uses built-in defaults

You can also specify a config file explicitly:

readability --config /path/to/.readability.yml docs/

docs.title: Complete Example
docs.text:
# .readability.yml
thresholds:
  max_grade: 12      # Maximum Flesch-Kincaid grade level
  max_ari: 12        # Maximum Automated Readability Index
  max_fog: 14        # Maximum Gunning Fog index
  min_ease: 30       # Minimum Flesch Reading Ease (0-100)
  max_lines: 500     # Maximum lines per file
  min_words: 100     # Skip readability check if below this word count

overrides:
  # API reference docs can be more technical
  - path: docs/api/
    thresholds:
      max_grade: 16
      max_ari: 16
      max_lines: 1000

  # Tutorials should be beginner-friendly
  - path: docs/tutorials/
    thresholds:
      max_grade: 8
      max_ari: 8
      min_ease: 60

  # Reference docs with lots of lists/tables break formulas
  - path: docs/reference/
    thresholds:
      max_grade: 50
      max_ari: 50
      min_ease: -100  # Negative value disables this check

docs.title: Threshold Fields
docs.text: Field Description Default max_grade Maximum Flesch-Kincaid grade level 16.0 max_ari Maximum Automated Readability Index 16.0 max_fog Maximum Gunning Fog index 18.0 min_ease Minimum Flesch Reading Ease score 25.0 max_lines Maximum lines per file 375 min_words Skip readability checks if word count is below this 100

docs.title: Understanding the Defaults
docs.text:
The defaults target college senior level reading comprehension:

Grade Level Audience 6-8 Middle school 8-10 MIL-STD-38784 (military technical manuals) 10-12 High school 12-14 College freshman/sophomore 14-16 College junior/senior 16+ Graduate level

docs.title: Disabling Checks
docs.text:
Use extreme values to effectively disable specific checks:

thresholds:
  max_grade: 50      # Effectively no grade limit
  min_ease: -100     # Negative values disable ease check
  max_lines: 0       # Zero disables line limit (via CLI only)

docs.title: Path Overrides
docs.text: Use overrides to apply different thresholds to specific directories or files.

docs.title: Matching Rules
docs.text:
• Paths use prefix matching
  • First matching override wins (order matters)
  • Unmatched files use the base thresholds
  • Paths are normalized (leading ./ and ../ stripped)

docs.title: Override Examples
docs.text:
overrides:
  # Match all files under docs/api/
  - path: docs/api/
    thresholds:
      max_grade: 16

  # Match a specific file
  - path: docs/changelog.md
    thresholds:
      max_lines: 2000

  # More specific paths should come first
  - path: docs/guides/advanced/
    thresholds:
      max_grade: 14
  - path: docs/guides/
    thresholds:
      max_grade: 10

docs.title: Partial Overrides
docs.text:
Override only the thresholds you need; others inherit from the base:

thresholds:
  max_grade: 12
  max_ari: 12
  max_lines: 500

overrides:
  - path: docs/api/
    thresholds:
      max_grade: 16  # Only override grade; ari and lines inherit

docs.title: CLI Overrides
docs.text:
Command-line flags take precedence over config file values:

# Config says max_grade: 12, but use 10 for this run
readability --max-grade 10 docs/

# Disable line limit for a single run
readability --max-lines 0 docs/

# Use a different config file
readability --config custom-config.yml docs/

docs.title: GitHub Action Usage
docs.text:
The GitHub Action automatically detects .readability.yml:

- uses: adaptive-enforcement-lab/readability@v1
  with:
    path: docs/
    check: true  # Fail if thresholds exceeded

See GitHub Action Configuration for more options.

docs.title: GitHub Action
docs.text: Integrate Readability into your CI/CD pipeline to automatically check documentation quality on every pull request.

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text:
name: Documentation Quality

on:
  pull_request:
    paths:
      - 'docs/**'

jobs:
  readability:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - uses: adaptive-enforcement-lab/readability@v1
        with:
          path: docs/
          check: true

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Automatic Go installation and build
  • Multiple output formats
  • Threshold enforcement
  • Configuration file support

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:

  • Examples - Common workflow patterns

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Default path Path to analyze (file or directory) docs/ format Output format (table, markdown, json, summary, report) markdown config Path to config file (auto-detect .readability.yml) check Fail on threshold violations false max-grade Maximum Flesch-Kincaid grade level (from config) max-ari Maximum ARI score (from config) max-lines Maximum lines per file (from config)

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description report Analysis report in JSON format passed Whether all thresholds were met (true/false) files-analyzed Number of files analyzed

docs.title: Configuration File Auto-Detection
docs.text:
The action automatically detects .readability.yml in your repository root. You don't need to specify the config input unless using a different filename or location.

# .readability.yml is auto-detected
- uses: adaptive-enforcement-lab/readability@v1
  with:
    path: docs/
    check: true

docs.title: Using Outputs
docs.text:
Access the action outputs in subsequent steps:

- uses: adaptive-enforcement-lab/readability@v1
  id: readability
  with:
    path: docs/
    check: false  # Don't fail, just report

- name: Check results
  run: |
    echo "Files analyzed: ${{ steps.readability.outputs.files-analyzed }}"
    echo "All passed: ${{ steps.readability.outputs.passed }}"

- name: Fail if readability issues
  if: steps.readability.outputs.passed == 'false'
  run: exit 1

docs.title: Example with All Options
docs.text:
- uses: adaptive-enforcement-lab/readability@v1
  with:
    path: docs/
    format: markdown
    config: .readability.yml
    check: true
    max-grade: 12
    max-ari: 14
    max-lines: 500

docs.title: Report Only (No Failure)
docs.text:
Generate a report without failing the build:

- uses: adaptive-enforcement-lab/readability@v1
  with:
    path: docs/
    format: markdown

docs.title: Strict Enforcement
docs.text:
Fail if any document exceeds thresholds:

- uses: adaptive-enforcement-lab/readability@v1
  with:
    path: docs/
    check: true
    max-grade: 10

docs.title: JSON Output for Processing
docs.text:
- uses: adaptive-enforcement-lab/readability@v1
  id: readability
  with:
    path: docs/
    format: json

- name: Process results
  run: |
    echo "${{ steps.readability.outputs.report }}" | jq '.[] | select(.status == "fail")'

docs.title: Metrics
docs.text: Readability calculates several standard readability metrics to help you understand how accessible your documentation is.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Metric Range What It Measures Flesch Reading Ease 0-100 Overall readability (higher = easier) Flesch-Kincaid Grade 0-18+ US grade level required ARI 0-20+ US grade level (character-based) Gunning Fog 0-20+ Years of education needed SMOG 0-20+ Years of education (based on polysyllables) Coleman-Liau 0-20+ US grade level (character-based)

docs.title: Recommended Targets
docs.text: Audience Grade Level Flesch Ease General public 6-8 60-70 High school 9-12 50-60 Technical professionals 12-14 30-50 Academic/specialist 14+ 0-30

docs.title: Learn More
docs.text:
• Flesch Reading Ease - The most common readability score
  • Grade Level Scores - Understanding grade-level metrics
  • Thresholds - Setting appropriate limits

docs.title: Flesch Reading Ease
docs.text: The Flesch Reading Ease score is one of the most widely used readability metrics. Higher scores indicate easier-to-read content.

docs.title: Score Interpretation
docs.text: Score Difficulty Typical Audience 90-100 Very Easy 5th grade 80-90 Easy 6th grade 70-80 Fairly Easy 7th grade 60-70 Standard 8th-9th grade 50-60 Fairly Difficult 10th-12th grade 30-50 Difficult College 0-30 Very Difficult College graduate

docs.title: Formula
docs.text:
206.835 - 1.015 × (words / sentences) - 84.6 × (syllables / words)

The formula penalizes:

  • Long sentences (more words per sentence)
  • Complex words (more syllables per word)

docs.title: Recommendations
docs.text:
For technical documentation:

  • API Reference: 30-50 is acceptable
  • User Guides: Aim for 50-60
  • Tutorials: Target 60-70

docs.title: Improving Your Score
docs.text:
1. Shorter sentences - Break up complex sentences
  2. Simpler words - Use "use" instead of "utilize"
  3. Active voice - "The API returns data" vs "Data is returned by the API"
  4. Remove filler - Cut unnecessary words

docs.title: Grade Level Scores
docs.text: Grade level metrics estimate the US school grade level required to understand the text.

docs.title: Metrics Comparison
docs.text: Metric Focus Best For Flesch-Kincaid Sentence length, syllables General use ARI Characters per word Technical content Gunning Fog Complex words Business writing SMOG Polysyllables Healthcare/education Coleman-Liau Character counts Academic assessment

docs.title: Flesch-Kincaid Grade Level
docs.text:
The most common grade-level metric.

Formula: 

0.39 × (words / sentences) + 11.8 × (syllables / words) - 15.59

docs.title: ARI (Automated Readability Index)
docs.text:
Uses characters instead of syllables, making it more consistent for technical content.

Formula: 

4.71 × (characters / words) + 0.5 × (words / sentences) - 21.43

docs.title: Gunning Fog Index
docs.text:
Focuses on "complex words" (3+ syllables, excluding common suffixes).

Formula: 

0.4 × ((words / sentences) + 100 × (complex words / words))

docs.title: Which to Use?
docs.text:
• Technical documentation: Use ARI or Flesch-Kincaid
  • Business content: Use Gunning Fog
  • Healthcare/education: Use SMOG
  • General purpose: Use Flesch-Kincaid as primary

docs.title: Thresholds
docs.text: Setting appropriate thresholds helps enforce documentation quality without being overly restrictive.

docs.title: Technical Documentation
docs.text:
thresholds:
  max_grade: 12
  max_ari: 14
  min_ease: 30
  max_lines: 500

docs.title: User Guides
docs.text:
thresholds:
  max_grade: 10
  max_ari: 12
  min_ease: 50
  max_lines: 300

docs.title: API Reference
docs.text:
thresholds:
  max_grade: 14
  max_ari: 16
  min_ease: 20
  max_lines: 1000

docs.title: Content-Specific Overrides
docs.text:
Different content types need different thresholds:

thresholds:
  max_grade: 10

overrides:
  - pattern: "docs/api/**"
    thresholds:
      max_grade: 14

  - pattern: "docs/tutorials/**"
    thresholds:
      max_grade: 8

docs.title: When to Skip Checks
docs.text:
Set min_words to skip readability checks for very short documents:

thresholds:
  min_words: 100

Documents with fewer than 100 words won't fail readability checks (the formulas are unreliable with sparse content).

docs.title: Line Limits
docs.text:
Use max_lines to encourage document splitting:

thresholds:
  max_lines: 500

Long documents should typically be split into focused sections.
